data.name: AddNpcToFactionHelp
data.value: Adds new NPC identity to this faction - faction will not cease to exist when last player leaves. Available in scenario edit mode only.

data.name: AdminMenuNotAvailable
data.value: Admin menu is available only when you're admin or when admin promotes you to Observer and beyond

data.name: AnonymousActivityTracking_Text1
data.value: Data protection laws have changed in the European Union and we want to make sure you review how your personal data is processed in Space Engineers.

data.name: AnonymousActivityTracking_Text2
data.value: By clicking Yes you agree to the collection of anonymized data for the purpose of improving the game experience. You can change your mind at any time by going to Options -> Game, and changing Anonymous Activity Tracking.

data.name: Antenna_IgnoreAlliedBroadcastTooltip
data.value: Ignores broadcasts sent by friendly antenna that do not belong to you

data.name: Antenna_IgnoreOtherBroadcastTooltip
data.value: Ignores broadcasts sent by neutral and enemy antenna

data.name: BlockActionTooltip_AddPistonHead
data.value: Tries to add a piston head if no head is present

data.name: BlockActionTooltip_AddRotorHead
data.value: Tries to add a Rotor head if no head is present

data.name: BlockActionTooltip_AddSmallRotorHead
data.value: Tries to add a Small Rotor head on Large Rotor if no head is present

data.name: BlockActionTooltip_AddWheel
data.value: Tries to add a Wheel if no wheel is present

data.name: BlockActionTooltip_SelectedJumpTarget
data.value: To execute the jump, assign the "Jump" command to the toolbar of a cockpit

data.name: BlockActionTooltip_WaypointReset
data.value: Resets current waypoint to first position

data.name: BlockPropertiesText_HeadAttachingAny
data.value: Looking for any Head to attach

data.name: BlockPropertiesText_HeadAttachingSpecific
data.value: Looking for specific Head to attach

data.name: BlockPropertiesText_MotoLockOverrideDisabled
data.value: The current rotor rotation speed is too high. Rotor will be locked when angular velocity gets lower.

data.name: BlockPropertiesText_MotorAttachingAny
data.value: Looking for any rotor to attach

data.name: BlockPropertiesText_MotorAttachingSpecific
data.value: Looking for specific rotor to attach

data.name: BlockPropertiesText_MotorLimitsDisabled
data.value: The current rotor rotation is out of limits, the limits will be enabled when the rotor is within range

data.name: BlockPropertiesTooltip_Projector_GetOwnership
data.value: All blocks from the spawned ship will have the same ownership settings as this projector

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_AnyoneCanUse
data.value: If false checks whether player pressing button has access to the block

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_BreakForce
data.value: Landing gear will unlock automatically when force applied to keep it attached is larger than this value

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_Connector_Strength
data.value: Connector strength when aligning ship (yellow color), smaller strength of two connectors is used

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_Depressurize
data.value: The vent will remove air from the room and store it in tanks

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_GravityFieldDepth
data.value: Depth of the gravity field of the generator

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_GravityFieldHeight
data.value: Height of the gravity field of the generator

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_GravityFieldWidth
data.value: Width of the gravity field of the generator

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_GyroOverride
data.value: If set, the gyro does not respond to cockpit controls, but can instead be controlled manually using the terminal control sliders

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_GyroPitchOverride
data.value: Pitch component of the constant torque that is applied by this gyro if the cockpit controls are overridden

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_GyroRollOverride
data.value: Roll component of the constant torque that is applied by this gyro if the cockpit controls are overridden

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_GyroYawOverride
data.value: Yaw component of the constant torque that is applied by this gyro if the cockpit controls are overridden

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_LightBlinkLenght
data.value: Length of blinking as percentage of blink interval

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_LightBlinkOffset
data.value: Offset of blinking as percentage of blink interval

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_LightFalloff
data.value: Exponential falloff of the light (1 = linear, 2 = quadratic, etc)

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_LightOffset
data.value: Offset of the light from model

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_LightRadius
data.value: Radius of influence of the light

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_LightReflectorRadius
data.value: Reflector radius of influence of the light

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_MotorBrakingTorque
data.value: Braking strength of the rotor: how fast it will stop (applied when the rotor is turned off)

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_MotorLock
data.value: Rotor will lock its current position

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_MotorRotorDisplacement
data.value: Allows to move the rotor grid up or down to solve various alignment issues

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_MotorTorque
data.value: The torque of the rotor: how fast it will accelerate (applied when the rotor is turned on)

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_MotorUsesWheelCommands
data.value: Indicates whether motor is controlled like a wheel directly from cockpit

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_MotorVelocity
data.value: Target velocity of the rotor; the rotor will accelerate until the target velocity is reached

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_Motor_Friction
data.value: Regulates wheel friction by changing pressure in the tire

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_Motor_MaxSteerAngle
data.value: The maximum angle that the wheel will turn when steering

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_Motor_Steering
data.value: Control steering of this suspension from cockpit

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_Motor_SteerReturnSpeed
data.value: The wheel's return speed from turning

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_Motor_SuspensionSpeed
data.value: Wheels will not be propeled over this speed

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_Motor_SuspensionTravel
data.value: Limits the suspension's travel height. Setting to 0% will effectively lock the suspension.

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_SensorFieldBack
data.value: How far the sensing field extends backwards from the sensor's position

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_SensorFieldBottom
data.value: How far the sensing field extends below the sensor's position

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_SensorFieldFront
data.value: How far the sensing field extends in front of the sensor

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_SensorFieldLeft
data.value: How far the sensing field extends to the left from the sensor's position

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_SensorFieldRight
data.value: How far the sensing field extends to the right from the sensor's position

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_SensorFieldTop
data.value: How far the sensing field extends above the sensor's position

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_Stockpile
data.value: Stockpiling tanks will not get drained by air vents

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_Suspension_AirShock
data.value: Automatically increases the strength of suspension spring when it is about to land hard.

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_ThrustOverride
data.value: Overriding thruster will cause activation of thruster even without cockpit

data.name: BlockPropertyPopup_AutoPilotToolbarOpen
data.value: Set actions to be done when autopilot reaches this waypoint

data.name: BlockPropertyTitle_Projector_BlocksPerProjection_Tooltip
data.value: The maximum number of blocks a projection can have when building instantly

data.name: BlockPropertyTitle_Projector_InstantBuilding_Tooltip
data.value: Enable the projector to build the blueprint instantly, even in survival

data.name: BlockPropertyTitle_Projector_NumberOfProjections_Tooltip
data.value: The maximum number of projections this projector can build instantly

data.name: BlockPropertyTitle_Recharge
data.comment: Recharge checkbox in terminal (eg. on BatteryBlock).

data.name: BlockPropertyTooltip_MaxImpulseAxis
data.value:
Maximum force the piston is allowed to apply to blocking obstacle along it's extending axis.
High values may result in unexpected behaviour.

data.name: BlockPropertyTooltip_MaxImpulseNonAxis
data.value:
Maximum force the piston is allowed to apply to blocking obstacle along it's lateral axis
High values may result in unexpected behaviour.

data.name: BlockPropertyTooltip_ShareTensor
data.value: Equalizes virtual masses of connected grids to achieve more stable behaviour

data.name: BriefingTutorial01Movements
data.value: Learn movement essentials, how to keep your engineer alive with life support energy and oxygen and how to use each of the character tools, the welder, grinder and hand drill.

data.name: BriefingTutorial02Inventory
data.value: An introduction to player and cargo inventories, how to add/withdraw items and a basic initiation to control panels and terminals for controlling block functions.

data.name: BriefingTutorial03Energy
data.value: Learn how to recharge your suit energy by tackling a series of small challenges that explain the behaviour of power within Space Engineers and the different ways you can provide it.

data.name: BriefingTutorial04Oxygen
data.value: This tutorial covers the various oxygen related blocks, oxygen farms, generators, vents, bottles, tanks and ice, including their control panel functions. The concept of creating an airtight room for pressurization is also addressed.

data.name: BriefingTutorial05OreRefining
data.value: The basics of infrastructure and industry are taught in this tutorial. You will learn how to mine ores, process them in a refinery and then commission new block components to be made in the assembler from the refined elements.

data.name: BriefingTutorial06Conveyors
data.value: Setting up a good conveyor system is very useful and can save you a lot of time. Learn how to move items through conveyors and the different ways to have separate systems interact or connect with each other.

data.name: BriefingTutorial07Jetpack
data.value: The jetpack tutorial displays the controls needed for flight which is followed by a series of assault course style sections to challenge your ability to fly quickly and accurately, you have a limited time from the moment you begin each section to reach the exit door. Watch out for hazards!

data.name: BriefingTutorial08YourFirstShip
data.value: The true test of any engineer is the ability to build a space-worthy ship from scratch, this tutorial will provide instruction on how to build a simple one-person transport vessel. Learn how to place blocks, weld them to completion and make a simple flight, you will also be taught essential rules of ship building that you can apply to create your own designs.

data.name: BriefingTutorial09ShipFlight
data.value: This tutorial offers instruction on how to fly a ship and use the three ship tools. You must use each ship in turn to navigate through several chambers that demonstrate how to grind, weld and drill as well as how to stock a weld ships cargo and how to dock with connectors.

data.name: BriefingTutorial10Grids
data.value: This tutorial aims to illuminate the nature of small, large and station grids, the rules that govern them and how you can join them with the merge block. There is also a brief section on floating objects.

data.name: BroadcastScreen_TakeControlButtonDisabled_ToolTip
data.value: Cannot take control of target grid. Hover over status icons for more info.

data.name: BroadcastScreen_TakeControlButton_NoMainRemoteControl
data.value: Multiple Remote Controllers on grid. Set one as main!

data.name: BroadcastScreen_TerminalButtonDisabled_ToolTip
data.value: Cannot open terminal of target grid. Hover over status icons for more info.

data.name: ChatScreen_TerminalSendMessageDisabled
data.value: You cannot send an empty message

data.name: ControlScreen_ShareCombobox
data.value: Share selected blocks with another player/faction

data.name: ControlScreen_ShareComboboxDisabled
data.value: You need to be owner of the block to access it's sharing options

data.name: ControlScreen_TerminalBlockGroup
data.value: Insert name of a new block group

data.name: ControlScreen_TerminalBlockGroupDeleteDisabled
data.value: You need to select a block group before you can remove it

data.name: ControlScreen_TerminalBlockGroupSave
data.value: Create a new block group from selected blocks

data.name: ControlScreen_TerminalBlockGroupSaveDisabled
data.value: You need to insert a group name before you can create a new block group

data.name: ControlScreen_TransferCombobox
data.value: Transfer ownership of selected blocks to another player/faction

data.name: Default_Astronaut
data.comment: Name of the character model in select box of wardrobe

data.name: DefinitionError_BlockWithComputerNotTerminalBlock
data.value: Definition for {0} contains computer, but the block's TypeId is not a terminal block. This means that the block can be owned, but the ownership cannot be changed via terminal. Hint: Try setting the TypeId to any block that is in the terminal - the simplest case being just TerminalBlock

data.name: DeleteBlueprintQuestion
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this blueprint?

data.name: Description_Welder
data.value: A tool for building and repairing. Hold Left Mouse Button to weld. Press Right Mouse Button to put missing components to Build Planner.

data.name: Description_AngleGrinder
data.value: A tool for deconstructing and salvaging. Hold left Mouse Button to grind.

data.name: Description_HandDrill
data.value: A tool to break down rock to collect minerals. Hold down Left Mouse Button to drill. Hold Right Mouse Button to quickly dig tunnels.

data.name: Description_Rifle
data.value: A simple weapon to protect yourself.

data.name: Description_LightArmor
data.value: Basic armor to give structure and shape to ships and stations. Not very durable but lightweight.

data.name: Description_HeavyArmor
data.value: Heavy armor to give structure and shape to ships and stations. Durable but heavy.

data.name: Description_AdvancedRotor
data.value: Advanced rotors enable connected grids to rotate with the ability to transfer items between the grids.

data.name: Description_AdvancedRotorPart
data.value: The top part of an advanced rotor can be reattached to the rotor by accessing rotor settings.

data.name: Description_AirVent
data.value:
The Airvent can fill a sealed room with oxygen or extract oxygen from the atmosphere.
Oxygen is produced from ice in a h2/o2 generator or by oxygen farms. Use an oxygen tank for storage and conveyors to connect the blocks.

data.name: Description_RadioAntenna
data.value:
Antennas can be used to broadcast positions, messages HUD markers and allows grids to be accessed or controlled from a distance.
Antennas need to be able to send and receive, so make sure two antennas always overlap each other's position.

data.name: Description_VirtualMass
data.value: Artificial mass or spaceballs enable grids to react to artificial gravity.

data.name: Description_Assembler
data.value:
Assemblers are highly advanced machines capable of producing tools and components.
Requires ingots and power to produce components.

data.name: Description_AssemblerBasic
data.value:
A basic assembler to produce a limited selection of components.
Requires ingots and power to produce components.

data.name: Description_AtmosphericThrust
data.value: Atmospheric thrusters can only functions in planetary atmospheres.

data.name: Description_Battery
data.value: A battery stores power and is able to distribute a high output of energy.

data.name: Description_Beacon
data.value: A beacon is used to broadcast its position.

data.name: Description_ButtonPanel
data.value:
Button panels enable you to bind block functions to buttons that can be directly interacted with.
When highlighted, press [{CONTROL:TERMINAL}] to configure the buttons and [{CONTROL:USE}] to activate them.

data.name: Description_Camera
data.value:
The camera allows you to view remote locations and zoom in on distant objects.
Set up cameras on ship toolbars so you can zoom while using weapons or look behind you while docking.

data.name: Description_SmallCargoContainer
data.value: Small containers can be used to store items.

data.name: Description_MediumCargoContainer
data.value: Medium containers can be used to store items.

data.name: Description_LargeCargoContainer
data.value: Large containers can be used to store many items.

data.name: Description_SteelCatwalk
data.value: Catwalks can be used to build walkways or function as thin walls.

data.name: Description_Cockpit
data.value:
Cockpits are used to control your ship.
Connect a cockpit with oxygen tanks and h2/o2 generators to supply the cockpit with oxygen.

data.name: Description_FighterCockpit
data.value:
Fighter cockpits are used to control ships and offer a little more protection than normal cockpits.
Connect the cockpit with Oxygen tanks and h2/o2 generators to supply the cockpit with oxygen.

data.name: Description_Collector
data.value: Collectors collects items when they get close to the collector's funnel.

data.name: Description_Connector
data.value:
The connector can be magnetically locked with other connectors to allow cross grid distribution of items and power.
Toggle the magnetic lock from your toolbar or press [{CONTROL:LANDING_GEAR}]. Connectors will show up yellow when in range. Unlocking it will briefly disable the magnetic function.

data.name: Description_ControlPanel
data.value:
Control panels are simple panels that allow access to grid menus.
When highlighted, press [{CONTROL:TERMINAL}] to interact with the panel.

data.name: Description_ControlStation
data.value: Control stations are used to control a large ship.

data.name: Descripton_ConveyorJunction
data.value: Use conveyor tubes and junctions to connect inventories of blocks so that items and gases can move freely from one inventory to another.

data.name: Description_ConveyorSorter
data.value:
Conveyor sorters can be configured to only pass specific items through or stop specific items from passing through.
Sorters can be used to filter out unwanted materials or to collect specific items in a container.

data.name: Description_ConveyorTube
data.value: Use conveyor tubes and junctions to connect inventories of blocks so that items can move freely from one inventory to another.

data.name: Description_CornerLight
data.value: Lights are used to illuminate interiors or can be used to act as reference points on exteriors.

data.name: Description_CryoChamber
data.value:
Cryo rooms can store players while they are disconnected from a server.
Reduced oxygen consumption for player. Stores toolbar while offline. Connect the cryo room with Oxygen tanks, h2/o2 generators or oxygen farms with conveyors to supply oxygen.

data.name: Description_Decoy
data.value: Decoy's draw fire from enemy AI controlled turrets to distract them from more important targets.

data.name: Description_Door
data.value: Doors can seal off interiors and make them air tight while still allowing access for the player.

data.name: Description_Drill
data.value:
Ship drills are utility tools for mining on planets or asteroids to collect raw ores.
Can be used from a cockpit or turned on manually. Be careful not to get too close while it's active. Use conveyors to connect the drill with more storage blocks or refineries.

data.name: Description_Ejector
data.value:
The ejector allows small items to be ejected from small ships. Can also be used to access inventories.
You can use the ejector together with the conveyor sorter to collect and throw out specific items.

data.name: Description_FlightSeat
data.value: Flight seats are used to control a large ship and access all of its functions.

data.name: Description_FullCoverWall
data.value: Armored walls provide cover in interiors or can be used to prevent players from walking off ledges.

data.name: Description_GatlingGun
data.value:
Gatling guns are static weapons that require ammunition to function.
Set the Gatling gun on your ship toolbar to use this weapon. Connect the Gatling gun with conveyors so it can pull ammunition from other inventories automatically. Use a camera to zoom in on distant targets.

data.name: Description_GatlingTurret
data.value:
Gatling turrets are configurable automated turrets that will target anything hostile within range.
Requires large calibre ammunition. Can be controlled manually from cockpit. Connect the turret with conveyors so it can pull ammunition automatically.

data.name: Description_GravityGenerator
data.value: Gravity generators create configurable artificial gravity fields that affect players and items in an otherwise zero G environment. Has diminishing effects when inside a real gravity field.

data.name: Description_GravityGeneratorSphere
data.value: Spherical gravity generators create a configurable artificial spherical gravity field that affects players and items in an otherwise zero G environment. Has diminishing effects when inside a real gravity field.

data.name: Description_ShipGrinder
data.value: Ship grinders are utility tools for deconstructing grids. Can be used from a cockpit or turned on manually. Be careful not to get too close while it's active.

data.name: Description_Gyroscope
data.value:
Gyroscopes allow ships to orientate using the mouse movements and stabilize rotating grids.
Build more gyroscopes to increase sensitivity and the speed that a grid can turn.

data.name: Description_HangarDoor
data.value:
Hangar doors can be linked together to create large gates that can seal spaces air tight while allowing vehicles in and out.
You can build and use a button panel to open hangar doors by interacting with it or sensors to make them open and close automatically.

data.name: Description_HydrogenTank
data.value:
Hydrogen tanks are used for storing hydrogen fuel.
Hydrogen is used for hydrogen thrusters, engines or jetpack fuel. Hydrogen can be produced from ice in a h2/o2 generator. Can store and refill hydrogen bottles.

data.name: Description_HydrogenThrust
data.value:
Hydrogen thrusters are powerful thrusters that consume hydrogen and function in every environment.
Hydrogen can be produced from ice in a h2/o2 generator. Use a hydrogen tank for storage. Use Conveyors to transport the hydrogen.

data.name: Description_InteriorLight
data.value: Lights are used to illuminate interiors or can be used to act as reference points on exteriors.

data.name: Description_InteriorPillar
data.value: Interior pillars are used to reinforce structures.

data.name: Description_InteriorTurret
data.value:
Interior turrets are small automated turrets for protecting interiors or act as light defences.
Requires manual reloading and small calibre ammunition. Can be controlled manually from cockpits.

data.name: Description_InteriorWall
data.value: Interior walls are blocks with emissive lights to function as interior walls, ceilings or floors.

data.name: Description_IonThrust
data.value: Ion thrusters are advanced thrusters that function best in zero gravity environments.

data.name: Description_JumpDrive
data.value:
Jump drives allow ships to teleport over large distances.
They require a full charge to jump and can only be activated from the toolbar of a cockpit.

data.name: Description_TextPanel
data.value: LCD panels display pictograms or customized text.

data.name: Description_LandingGear
data.value:
Landing gears are capable of magnetically locking to any surface.
Landing gears can be locked and unlocked by pressing [{CONTROL:LANDING_GEAR}] when inside a cockpit. They will show up yellow when in range of a surface that they can lock onto.

data.name: Description_LaserAntenna
data.value:
Laser antennas do not broadcast a signal that other players can see but instead require direct line of sight to function.
This antenna is connected by using GPS coordinates.

data.name: Description_MedicalRoom
data.value: The Medical room enables you to respawn, change your appearance and recharge your health and energy much faster than the survival kit.

data.name: Description_MergeBlock
data.value:
Merge blocks can be used to permanently or temporarily connect two grids together and function as one grid.
Merge blocks will show up yellow when in range of another merge block.

data.name: Description_MissileTurret
data.value:
Missile turrets are configurable automated turrets that target anything hostile within its range.
Requires missiles. Can be controlled manually from a cockpit. Use conveyors to allow automatic reloading.

data.name: Description_ProductivityModule
data.value: Speed modules increase the production speed of refineries or assemblers when connected.

data.name: Description_EffectivenessModule
data.value: Yield modules increase production yield of refineries when connected.

data.name: Description_PowerEfficiencyModule
data.value: Power modules decrease power consumption of refineries or assemblers when connected.

data.name: Description_OreDetector
data.value: Ore detectors detect ores within a limited radius and makes them show up on your HUD.

data.name: Description_OxygenFarm
data.value:
Hydroponics farms produce small amounts of oxygen when in contact with sunlight.
Use an oxygen tank to store oxygen.

data.name: Description_OxygenGenerator
data.value:
h2/o2 generators produce oxygen and hydrogen from ice.
Use oxygen and hydrogen tanks for storage. Will refill bottles automatically.

data.name: Description_OxygenTank
data.value:
Oxygen tank store oxygen.
Able to store and refill oxygen bottles. Use h2/o2 generator to produce oxygen.

data.name: Description_ParachuteHatch
data.value:
Parachute hatches deploy parachutes to slow down the descent of ships when inside the atmosphere.
Can be configured to open automatically or used manually from the toolbar or settings.

data.name: Description_Passage
data.value: Passages allow passage either vertically or horizontally.

data.name: Description_PassengerSeat
data.value: A passenger seat can be used to transport other players.

data.name: Description_Piston
data.value: The piston is an expandable block that allows the transfer of power and items.

data.name: Description_PistonTop
data.value: This piston part is the top section of the piston.

data.name: Description_ProgrammableBlock
data.value:
A programmable block is a computer that runs scripts to manage ship systems.
Scripts can be found on the Workshop or written manually.

data.name: Description_Projector
data.value:
The projector block projects saved blueprints of ships so that they can be built easily.
Projection requires a connection with a grid from a projector in order to start construction.

data.name: Description_Ramp
data.value: The ramp block can be used to traverse heights or simply used for aesthetics.

data.name: Description_Reactor
data.value: Reactors generate high amounts of power at the cost of refined uranium ingots.

data.name: Description_Refinery
data.value:
Advanced refineries refine all ores into ingots.
They can be upgraded with upgrade modules.

data.name: Description_RefineryBasic
data.value: Basic refineries refines limited types of ores into ingots.

data.name: Description_RocketLauncherReload
data.value:
Reloadable rocket launchers can be connected with other inventories for automated reloading.
Requires missiles.

data.name: Description_RemoteControl
data.value: Remote controls allow ships to be controlled from a distance when combined with an antenna or commands ships to fly automatically to waypoints.

data.name: Description_RocketLauncher
data.value:
The rocket launcher has a limited magazine and is a forward-facing weapon.
Requires missiles.

data.name: Description_Rotor
data.value: Rotors allows connected grids to rotate.

data.name: Description_RotorPart
data.value:
The rotor part is the top section of the rotor.
It can be reattached with a rotor within rotor settings.

data.name: Description_Sensor
data.value: Sensors can be set up to activate ship systems when they detects players, ships or asteroids within a limited range.

data.name: Description_SolarPanel
data.value:
Solar panels generate power when exposed to sunlight.
Point solar panels directly at the sun to improve the amount of power generated.

data.name: Description_Sound
data.value: Sound blocks emit sounds when activated.

data.name: Description_SpaceBall
data.value: A spherical block that reacts to gravity.

data.name: Description_ReflectorLight
data.value: Spotlights are powerful lights used to illuminate dark areas.

data.name: Description_Stairs
data.value: Stairs can be used to traverse heights.

data.name: Description_Timer
data.value:
Timer blocks can be used to activate configured ship systems after a set amount of time.
Use multiple timer blocks to build sequences. Can be used to automate systems.

data.name: Description_Warhead
data.value:
Warheads are powerful explosives that can be used to destroy asteroids, enemy ships and stations.
Safe when unarmed. They can be detonated manually, by taking damage or set to detonate after a configurable amount of time.

data.name: Description_ShipWelder
data.value:
A Ship welder is a utility tool that can construct blueprints and blocks using components from its inventory.
Can be used from a cockpit or turned on manually. Be careful not to get too close while it's active. Press RMB to put missing components to Build Planner.

data.name: Description_Wheel
data.value: Wheels can be used to traverse terrain in environments with gravity.

data.name: Description_Suspension
data.value: Suspensions are highly durable and enable vehicles to drive over most terrains.

data.name: Description_Window
data.value: Transparent windows will keep the air in and space out while you enjoy the view.

data.name: Description_VerticalWindow
data.value: Vertical windows can be used to funnel air through and keep engineers out.

data.name: Description_DiagonalWindow
data.value: Diagonal window shutters can be used as stairs.

data.name: Description_SurvivalKit
data.value: All in one factory to get a space engineer started, but it has limited refining and assembling capabilities. Allows the player to recharge.

data.name: Description_WindTurbine
data.value: The Wind turbine generates low amounts of power when exposed to open areas. Only works on planets with atmosphere.

data.name: Description_PowerGenerator
data.value: The hydrogen engine converts hydrogen into power and has its own internal hydrogen tank.

data.name: Description_Ladder
data.value: The ladder enables you to traverse vertical spaces.

data.name: Description_Desk
data.value: A desk for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

data.name: Description_DeskCorner
data.value: A desk for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

data.name: Description_Lockers
data.value: Personalized lockers for decorating interiors and store your essentials.

data.name: Description_LockerRoom
data.value: A locker to store tools, weapons, ammunition and bottles.

data.name: Description_LockerRoomCorner
data.value: A locker to store tools, weapons, ammunition and bottles.

data.name: Description_Couch
data.value: A couch for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

data.name: Description_CornerCouch
data.value: A couch for decorating interior corners. Can be used as a seat.

data.name: Description_Bathroom
data.value: A toilet for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

data.name: Description_BathroomOpen
data.value: A toilet for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

data.name: Description_ToiletSeat
data.value: A toilet for decorating interiors. Can be used as a seat.

data.name: Description_Console

Connect a cockpit with oxygen tanks and h2/o2 generators to supply the cockpit with oxygen.

data.name: Hint00Text
data.value:
Did you know?
You can build blocks from any cockpit by pressing Ctrl-G.

data.name: Hint01Text
data.value:
Did you know?
You can toggle off the block auto rotation function with {0}.

data.name: Hint02Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Shift-{0} will directly bring you to the antenna menu.

data.name: Hint03Text
data.value: You can steer vehicles from a turret if the cockpit is set to main cockpit. Hold Alt to enable mouse control.

data.name: Hint04Text
data.value:
Stuck?
Pressing {0} enables you to respawn.

data.name: Hint05Text
data.value:
Did you know?
You can dig tunnels quickly without producing ore by using right mouse function with your drill.

data.name: Hint06Text
data.value: A few well placed decoy blocks can make the difference between a victory and a loss.

data.name: Hint07Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Meteor impact craters can leave valuable resources.

data.name: Hint08Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Dark spots on planets indicate ore deposits.

data.name: Hint09Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Rocks on the surface of planets often contain valuable resources.

data.name: Hint10Text
data.value:
Did you know?
While driving a rover, Hold {0} to brake.

data.name: Hint11Text
data.value: Be careful using your jetpack on planets. Your hydrogen fuel will run out quickly.

data.name: Hint12Text
data.value:
Did you know?
you can open the color picker by pressing {0}.

data.name: Hint13Text
data.value: Batteries will automatically charge and distribute power when necessary according to their settings.

data.name: Hint14Text
data.value: Upgrade modules will improve the performance of your refineries and assemblers.

data.name: Hint15Text
data.value: You can save Creations by pressing CTRL-B. Open the blueprint menu with F10.

data.name: Hint16Text
data.value: While holding a blueprint in creative mode, you can use B to align them to a planet's Gravity.

data.name: Hint17Text
data.value: Using a ship to grind down a container will also pick up whatever was inside of the container.

data.name: Hint18Text
data.value: Double clicking items will automatically transfer the whole stack between inventories.

data.name: Hint19Text
data.value: Holding Ctrl, Shift or Ctrl-Shift enables you to move stacks of items by 10, 100 and 1000 at the time.

data.name: Hint20Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Scrolling while using a camera or turret enables you to zoom in and out.

data.name: Hint21Text
data.value:
Did you know?
You can manually control turrets to carefully pick off targets.

data.name: Hint22Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Your magnetic boots only work when there is no gravity around.

data.name: Hint23Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Double click while wielding a tool will keep it continuously working.

data.name: Hint24Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Warheads are perfectly safe until you arm them.

data.name: Hint25Text
data.value:
Did you know?
O2/H2 generator can produce small amounts of hydrogen for thrusters without having a hydrogen tank involved.

data.name: Hint26Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Press {0} to change the way GPS coordinates and Antennas are displayed on your HUD.

data.name: Hint27Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Blocks that are destroyed during collisions or combat can cause damage around them.

data.name: Hint28Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Pressurized environments will maintain optimal temperatures and recharge your health and oxygen.

data.name: Hint29Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Your suit's power drains faster when residing in cold or warm temperatures.

data.name: Hint30Text
data.value:
Did you know?
The medical room recharges your energy and health five times as fast as the survival kit.

data.name: Hint31Text
data.value:
Did you know?
You can use sensors to detect enemies located underground who are attempting to infiltrate your base.

data.name: Hint32Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Wind turbines are more efficient when placed in high and open spaces.

data.name: Hint33Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Rovers can use their wheel suspensions to jump out of tight situations.

data.name: Hint34Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Advanced refineries give better yield when refining minerals.

data.name: Hint35Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Your jet pack can match the velocity of nearby grids using relative dampeners.

data.name: Hint36Text
data.value:
Did you know?
Wheel suspensions use power based on their power setting.

data.name: Hint37Text
data.value:
Did you know?
You can use /F to chat with your faction only or /g for global.

data.name: ProgrammableBlock_DefaultScript_Constructor
data.value:
The constructor, called only once every session and always before any other method is called. Use it to initialize your script.
The constructor is optional and can be removed if not needed.
It's recommended to set RuntimeInfo.UpdateFrequency here, which will allow your script to run itself without a timer block.

data.name: ProgrammableBlock_DefaultScript_Main
data.value:
The main entry point of the script, invoked every time one of the programmable block's Run actions are invoked, or the script updates itself. The updateSource argument describes where the update came from.
The method itself is required, but the arguments above can be removed if not needed.

data.name: ProgrammableBlock_DefaultScript_Save
data.value:
Called when the program needs to save its state. Use this method to save your state to the Storage field or some other means.
This method is optional and can be removed if not needed.

data.name: Quote00Text
data.value: Scientists discover the world that exists; Engineers create the world that never was.

data.name: Quote01Text
data.value: Scientific discovery and scientific knowledge have been achieved only by those who have gone in pursuit of it without any practical purpose whatsoever in view.

data.name: Quote02Text
data.value: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.

data.name: Quote03Text
data.value: When a distinguished but elderly scientist states that something is possible, he is almost certainly right. When he states that something is impossible, he is very probably wrong.

data.name: Quote04Text
data.value: Science may set limits to knowledge, but should not set limits to imagination.

data.name: Quote05Text
data.value: Nothing shocks me. I'm a scientist.

data.name: Quote06Text
data.value: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.

data.name: Quote07Text
data.value: A new scientific truth does not triumph by convincing its opponents and making them see the light, but rather because its opponents eventually die, and a new generation grows up that is familiar with it.

data.name: Quote08Text
data.value: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.

data.name: Quote09Text
data.value: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.

data.name: Quote10Text
data.value: Nature never breaks her own laws.

data.name: Quote12Text
data.value: Where there is shouting, there is no true knowledge.

data.name: Quote13Text
data.value: I have offended God and mankind because my work didn't reach the quality it should have.

data.name: Quote14Text
data.value: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.

data.name: Quote15Text
data.value: By denying scientific principles, one may maintain any paradox.

data.name: Quote16Text
data.value: Mathematics is the language in which God has written the universe.

data.name: Quote17Text
data.value: If I were again beginning my studies, I would follow the advice of Plato and start with mathematics.

data.name: Quote18Text
data.value: We see only what we know.

data.name: Quote19Text
data.value: If anybody says he can think about quantum problems without getting giddy, that only shows he has not understood the first thing about them.

data.name: Quote20Text
data.value: Only one thing is certain - that is, nothing is certain. If this statement is true, it is also false.

data.name: Quote21Text
data.value: Scientists are explorers. Philosophers are tourists.

data.name: Quote22Text
data.value: A great pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.

data.name: Quote23Text
data.value: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.

data.name: Quote24Text
data.value: I know one thing: that I know nothing.

data.name: Quote25Text
data.value: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.

data.name: Quote26Text
data.value: When you want to know how things really work, study them when they're coming apart.

data.name: Quote27Text
data.value: Engineers like to solve problems. If there are no problems handily available, they will create their own problems.

data.name: Quote28Text
data.value: One man's "magic" is another man's engineering. "Supernatural" is a null word.

data.name: Quote29Text
data.value: A good scientist is a person with original ideas. A good engineer is a person who makes a design that works with as few original ideas as possible. There are no prima donnas in engineering.

data.name: Quote30Text
data.value: Aviation is the branch of engineering that is least forgiving of mistakes.

data.name: Quote31Text
data.value: A space engineer is a professional practitioner who uses scientific knowledge, mathematics, physics, astronomy, propulsion technology, materials science, structural analysis, manufacturing and ingenuity to solve practical problems in space.

data.name: Quote32Text
data.value: Space engineers design materials, structures, and systems while considering the limitations imposed by practicality, regulation, safety, ethicality and cost.

data.name: Quote33Text
data.value: Space engineers are grounded in applied sciences, and their work in research and development is distinct from the basic research focus of space scientists.

data.name: Quote34Text
data.value: In war times, space engineering involves military engineering as well. Such tasks typically include construction and demolition tasks under combat conditions.

data.name: Quote35Text
data.value: Space engineers are in a high demand, especially since the Second Space Race of 2029.

data.name: Quote36Text
data.value: Space engineers take pride for their ability to get the job done right - no matter how big, how complex, or how remote.

data.name: Quote37Text
data.value: The word engineer is derived from the Latin roots 'ingeniare' ("to contrive, devise") and 'ingenium' ("cleverness").

data.name: Quote38Text
data.value: To the optimist, the glass is half full. To the pessimist, the glass is half empty. To the engineer, the glass is twice as big as it needs to be.

data.name: Quote39Text
data.value: Scientists investigate that which already is; engineers create that which has never been.

data.name: Quote41Text
data.value: If you see a bomb technician running, follow him.

data.name: Quote42Text
data.value: The only time you have too much fuel is when you're on fire.

data.name: Quote44Text
data.value: A pilot who doesn't have any fear probably isn't flying his plane to its maximum.

data.name: Quote45Text
data.value: To an engineer, good enough means perfect. With an artist, there's no such thing as perfect.

data.name: Quote46Text
data.value: Mars is there, waiting to be reached.

data.name: Quote47Text
data.value: This is one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind.

data.name: Quote48Text
data.value: I see Earth! It is so beautiful!

data.name: Quote49Text
data.value: I could have gone on flying through space forever.

data.name: Quote50Text
data.value: To go places and do things that have never been done before - that's what living is all about.

data.name: Quote51Text
data.value: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

data.name: Quote52Text
data.value: To be the first to enter the cosmos, to engage, single-handed, in an unprecedented duel with nature - could one dream of anything more?

data.name: Quote53Text
data.value: The path of a cosmonaut is not an easy, triumphant march to glory. You have to get to know the meaning not just of joy but also of grief, before being allowed in the spacecraft cabin.

data.name: Quote54Text
data.value: The dreams of yesterday are the hopes of today and the reality of tomorrow.

data.name: Quote56Text
data.value: No amount of experimentation can ever prove me right; a single experiment can prove me wrong.

data.name: Quote57Text
data.value: Science never solves a problem without creating ten more.

data.name: Quote58Text
data.value: The law of conservation of energy states that energy can be neither created nor destroyed. However, energy can change forms, and energy can flow from one place to another. The total energy of an isolated system remains the same.

data.name: Quote59Text
data.value: The flow of heat is a form of energy transfer. In other words, a quantity of heat that flows from a hot body to a cold one can be expressed as an amount of energy being transferred from the hot body to the cold one.

data.name: Quote60Text
data.value: Every body persists in its state of being at rest or of moving uniformly straight forward, except insofar as it is compelled to change its state by force impressed.

data.name: Quote61Text
data.value: An object that is at rest will stay at rest unless an external force acts upon it.

data.name: Quote62Text
data.value: An object that is in motion will not change its velocity unless an external force acts upon it.

data.name: Quote63Text
data.value: The acceleration of a body is directly proportional to, and in the same direction as, the net force acting on the body, and inversely proportional to its mass.

data.name: Quote64Text
data.value: To every action there is always an equal and opposite reaction: or the forces of two bodies on each other are always equal and are directed in opposite directions.

data.name: Quote65Text
data.value: SCIENTIFIC METHOD: principles and procedures for the systematic pursuit of knowledge involving the recognition and formulation of a problem, the collection of data through observation and experiment, and the formulation and testing of hypotheses.

data.name: Quote66Text
data.value: To be termed scientific, a method of inquiry must be based on empirical and measurable evidence subject to specific principles of reasoning.

data.name: Quote67Text
data.value: The laws of science or scientific laws are statements that describe, predict, and perhaps explain why, a range of phenomena behave as they appear to in nature.

data.name: Quote68Text
data.value: Scientific laws are strongly supported by empirical evidence - they are scientific knowledge that experiments have repeatedly verified (and never falsified).

data.name: Quote69Text
data.value: Every point mass in the universe attracts every other point mass with a force that is directly proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

data.name: RemoteAccess_Description
data.value:
You can remotely access grids in the world using the antenna in your suit. Make sure your antenna is enabled. (Check the antenna symbol in the bottom left corner of the in-game HUD)
To access a grid, it must be powered and have an antenna. You also need to stay within the antenna broadcast range to be able to access it.
You can control grids from a distance by equipping them with a remote control block.

data.name: TerminalTab_Info_Description
data.value:
Building a grid partially inside of terrain automatically turns the grid into a station. Stations are more performance friendly but are static and cannot be moved.
You can convert any station into a ship. Be careful that it's not embedded in any terrain as it might explode.
A ship needs to be stationary in order to convert it into a station.

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsHardwareRequirements
data.value: Hardware requirements define how rich your world can be. Higher values are more demanding on computing performance of your computer (CPU and GPU) and will definitely require more memory.

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsHarvestingMode
data.value:
Creative Mode: unlimited resources, instant building, players don't die. Use creative mode when you just want to build things.
Survival Mode: realistic inventory capacity, constrained resources - you have to drill and harvest ore, process it in a refinery, construct components in assembler, build blocks using welder, disassemble using grinder, players can die - they re-spawn in their spawn point and if there's no spawn point available, then in a new ship as a new player at the border of the sector.
Survival x3: same as "Survival", but 3x larger inventory capacity.
Survival x10: same as "Survival", but 10x larger inventory capacity.

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsLimitWorldSize
data.value: When set, the game area is limited to a cube with the side length set to the chosen size. All objects that leave the game area will be removed from the game. Characters leaving the game area will be killed.

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsMaxBackupSaves
data.value: Configure the maximum number of saves that should be backed up. The backup folder is located on the respective save directory. When this is 0 then the backup feature is disabled and all backups are deleted upon save!

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsMaxBlocksPerPlayer
data.value: Maximum number of blocks each player can build. Destroyed blocks are refunded.

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsMaxFloatingObjects
data.value: Maximum number of small objects floating in space (ore, ingots, components) Warning - values higher than 64 can significantly affect performance!

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsMaxGridSize

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsMaxPlayer

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsModeCreative

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsModeSurvival

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsPVP
data.value: PvE means that you cannot damage other players. PvP means that you can damage them and they can damage you.

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsRemoveTrash
data.value: If checked, ships that are considered to be trash will be removed to make the game run faster. To be considered trash, the grid has to contain just a few blocks, be in uniform linear motion, be unpowered, uncontrolled, without a medbay and far enough from all players so that they can barely see it.

data.value: If this is turned off, characters won't spawn with any tools in their inventory

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettings_StartInRespawnScreen
data.value: When played as scenario: player will start in respawn screen with new identity, all ownership will be lost

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettings_StationVoxelSupport
data.value: By enabling this option grids will no longer turn dynamic when disconnected from static grids

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettings_ToolShake
data.value: Enable shaking of ship drills and welders

data.name: UnsavedChangesQuestion
data.value: You have unsaved changes. Do you want to save current cutscene first?

data.name: WelcomeScreen_Text1
data.value: I would first like to personally thank you for choosing to support our game and its development. Many talented people been involved in this project during the last six years and we are honoured to have you join our community.

data.name: WelcomeScreen_Text2
data.value:
A space engineer is a professional practitioner who uses scientific knowledge, mathematics, physics, astronomy, propulsion technology, materials science, structural analysis, manufacturing, and ingenuity to solve practical problems in space and on planets.
Space engineers take pride in their ability to get the job done right. No matter how big, how complex, or how remote.

data.name: WelcomeScreen_Text3
data.value:
If you experience any issues, please do not hesitate to visit the support site or our Discord server where there are developers and many experienced players available to assist you!
If you're interested in seeing some of the potential of Space Engineers, be sure to visit the Steam Community Hub. We look forward to seeing your creations and screenshots on there in the future. Good luck engineering your dreams!

data.name: WorldSettings_WarningChangingWorldSize
data.value: The selected world size is more limited than the original one. Reducing world size in an existing save could delete some ships beyond the new limit. Are you sure you want to continue?

data.name: WorldSettings_Error_NameExists
data.value: The name you have entered already exists. Please change the name to something else.

data.name: WorldSettings_Error_SavingFailed
data.value: There was an error trying to rename your world. Please check your saves folder for any problems.

data.name: WwwLinkNotAllowed
data.value: This link is not allowed and will not open. Allowed sites: steamcommunity, youtube, KSH forum.

data.name: WwwLinkNotAllowed_Steam
data.value: This link is not allowed and will not open. Allowed sites: steamcommunity, youtube, KSH forum.

data.name: IngameHelp_HUD_Detail1
data.value: Cycle through the various HUD states; they differ by amount of shown information. You can also change the way signals show up on your HUD.

data.name: IngameHelp_HUD_Detail2
data.value: Press {0} to cycle through HUD states.

data.name: IngameHelp_HUD_Detail3
data.value: Press {0} to cycle through signal states.

data.name: IngameHelp_Jetpack2_Detail1
data.value: Turning off dampeners while flying allows you to move without slowing down when you let go of the input. This can be useful to move steady at low or high speeds without using much fuel.

data.name: IngameHelp_Building2_Detail1
data.value: Most blocks come in two sizes and can be rotated in any direction.

data.name: IngameHelp_Building2_Detail2
data.value: Select the same block twice on your toolbar to pick a size.

data.name: IngameHelp_Building2_Detail3
data.value: Use {0}, {1}, {2}, {3}, {4} and {5} keys to rotate blocks.

data.name: IngameHelp_Building_Detail1
data.value: You can build blocks anywhere in the world or add them to existing grids. The toolbar config screen will show you all available blocks that you can build.

data.name: IngameHelp_Building_Detail2
data.value: Press {0} to open toolbar config screen.

data.name: IngameHelp_Building_Detail3
data.value: Drag a block to your toolbar.

data.name: IngameHelp_Building3_Detail1
data.value: In survival mode you need the first component of a block to place it. You can produce components in assembler or salvage them from other blocks with a grinder.

data.name: IngameHelp_Ownership_Detail1
data.value: Blocks owned by other players cannot be accessed if they are not shared with others. You can hack blocks by replacing their computer parts with a grinder and welder to gain access.

data.name: IngameHelp_CameraTip_Detail1
data.value: You will be building in no time!

data.name: IngameHelp_CameraTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Third person camera will switch to first person if there are objects in your way.

data.name: IngameHelp_Power_Detail1
data.value: Blocks or entire grids can be turned off to save power and fuel. When you are in a cockpit, Press {0} to turn off and on the power production blocks.

data.name: IngameHelp_BuildingTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Blocks with a + symbol have variations available that you can scroll through.

data.name: IngameHelp_Building_Detail4
data.value: Select a block or tool by pressing 1 - 9

data.name: IngameHelp_HUDTip_Detail1
data.value: I could not have done it better myself!

data.name: IngameHelp_HUDTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* HUD signals can be individually disabled in your terminal control panel.

data.name: IngameHelp_IntroTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* You can ask me anything in the chat {0} using ? <question> (english only). In case of any troubles contact us at support@keenswh.com

data.name: IngameHelp_JetpackTip_Detail1
data.value: That is my definition of flying!

data.name: IngameHelp_JetpackTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Use relative dampening with [Ctrl+]{0} to keep velocity of the ship under cursor.

data.name: IngameHelp_InventoryTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* You can drag items out of your inventory to drop them again.

data.name: IngameHelp_Inventory_Detail1
data.value: Highlighted objects can be picked up if there is room in your inventory.

data.name: IngameHelp_Inventory_Detail2
data.value: Press {0} to pick up an item.

data.name: IngameHelp_EnergyTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Energy drains faster when it is hot or cold.

data.name: IngameHelp_Energy_Detail1
data.value: Your energy is getting low. Interact with a powered medical bay or survival kit to recharge your energy or use any kind of cockpit. Your tools need energy to function.

data.name: IngameHelp_HealthTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* You will also slowly heal in oxygenated environments.

data.name: IngameHelp_Health_Detail1
data.value: You're hurt. You can heal by interacting with the console of a powered medical bay or survival kit.

data.name: IngameHelp_HydrogenTip_Detail1
data.value: I think you are smarter than my maker!

data.name: IngameHelp_HydrogenTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* You can conserve hydrogen when in space by flying with dampeners off.

data.name: IngameHelp_Hydrogen_Detail1
data.value: Your hydrogen is getting low. Hydrogen is produced from ice in a h2/o2 generator. You can refill bottles at the generator or resupply directly by interacting with a medical bay or survival kit if it's connected with the h2/o2 generator.

data.name: IngameHelp_MagneticBootsTip_Detail1
data.value: The last Engineer took much longer to figure this out!

data.name: IngameHelp_MagneticBoots_Detail1
data.value: In zero gravity you can use your magnetic boots to walk on any surface. Position yourself with your feet down and turn off your jetpack to automatically lock your magnetic boots.

data.name: IngameHelp_MagneticBoots_Detail2
data.value: Use your magnetic boots in zero gravity.

data.name: IngameHelp_OxygenTip_Detail1
data.value: Breathing is preferable to not breathing!

data.name: IngameHelp_OxygenTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Walking consumes less oxygen than running or sprinting

data.name: IngameHelp_Oxygen_Detail1
data.value: Your oxygen is getting low. Oxygen is produced from ice in a h2/o2 generator. You can refill bottles at the generator or resupply directly by interacting with a medical bay or survival kit if it's connected with the h2/o2 generator.

data.name: IngameHelp_FlyingAShipTip_Detail1
data.value: Pilots take no special joy in walking. Pilots like flying. - Neil Armstrong

data.name: IngameHelp_FlyingAShipTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* You need thrusters in all six directions. More thrusters means faster acceleration!

data.name: IngameHelp_FlyingAShip_Detail1
data.value: A ship requires thrusters for movement, gyroscopes to orientate, power and a cockpit. The controls for a ship are the same as the jetpack.

data.name: IngameHelp_FlyingAShip_Detail2
data.value: Toggle {0} to turn power off and on.

data.name: IngameHelp_FlyingAShip_Detail3
data.value: Use {0} and {1} to go up and down.

data.name: IngameHelp_Grinder_Detail1
data.value: A grinder is used to deconstruct and salvage blocks by removing their components into your inventory.

data.name: IngameHelp_Grinder_Detail2
data.value: Hold {0} to use grinder on any block.

data.name: IngameHelp_GrinderTip_Detail1
data.value: You made quick work of that!

data.name: IngameHelp_GrinderTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Grinder's can be used to remove trees.

data.name: IngameHelp_HandDrill_Detail1
data.value: A hand drill is used to break down rock, collect minerals or to dig tunnels. Ores can be found in asteroids and dark spots on planets. All drills are equipped with a short-range detector.

data.name: IngameHelp_Rifle_Detail1
data.value: A basic weapon to protect yourself; requires small calibre ammunition.

data.name: IngameHelp_Rifle_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* There are more specialized rifles available. Don’t forget that you can review useful information anytime in the help screen by pressing {0}.

data.name: IngameHelp_WelderTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Use the {0} to store components from your inventory into a block under construction.

data.name: IngameHelp_Welder_Detail1
data.value: A welder is used to construct and repair blocks by adding the required components from your inventory.

data.name: IngameHelp_Welder_Detail2
data.value: Hold {0} to use the welder on any block.

data.name: IngameHelp_RefiningOre_Detail1
data.value: Ore and scrap metal can be refined into ingots in a powered Refinery. Ingots can be used to produce components, tools and weapons. Refineries will automatically pull resources and refine them.

data.name: IngameHelp_RefiningOre_Detail2
data.value: Use a survival kit or Refinery to process ore and obtain ingots.

data.name: IngameHelp_ComponentsTip_Detail1
data.value: Your skills are quickly becoming superior to mine!

data.name: IngameHelp_ComponentsTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Blocks with a + symbol have variations available that you can scroll through.

data.name: IngameHelp_Components_Detail1
data.value: Components are used to build and repair blocks. You can use a welder on any block to add the required component. You can select tools and blocks on your toolbar.

data.name: IngameHelp_FlashlightTip_Detail1
data.value: A little light goes a long way!

data.name: IngameHelp_FlashlightTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Remember, your flashlight consumes power from your suit.

data.name: IngameHelp_Flashlight_Detail1
data.value: Use your flashlight when entering dark areas.

data.name: IngameHelp_Flashlight_Detail2
data.value: Press {0} to toggle your flashlight off and on.

data.name: IngameHelp_Ingots_Detail1
data.value: Ingots can be used by a survival kit or assembler to produce components, tools and weapons. You can select what component to produce in the assembler's or survival kit's menu.

data.name: IngameHelp_Ingots_Detail2
data.value: Put iron ingot into Assembler inventory.

data.name: IngameHelp_Ingots_Detail3
data.value: Use a survival kit or Assembler to produce and obtain steel plates.

data.name: IngameHelp_InteractiveTip_Detail1
data.value: These skills will serve you well!

data.name: IngameHelp_InteractiveTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Build control panels to easily access ship menus.

data.name: IngameHelp_Interactive_Detail1
data.value: Many blocks like doors, button panels, consoles, medical rooms, inventories and cockpits support various different actions.

data.name: IngameHelp_Interactive_Detail2
data.value: Press {0} to activate a highlighted block.

data.name: IngameHelp_Interactive_Detail3
data.value: Press {0} to go to menu of highlighted block.

data.name: IngameHelp_Interactive_Detail4
data.value: Press {0} to open inventory of highlighted block.

data.name: IngameHelp_PowerTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Turn off blocks that you do not need to save power.

data.name: ChatBotUnavailable
data.value: I am sorry, I'm not available right now. Please visit https://support.keenswh.com/ or try again later.

data.name: ChatBot_Generic
data.value: Hello, Engineer! I am Good.bot. What can I help you with?
