data.name: Description_FAQ_Electricity
data.value: Electricity can be produced through reactors or solar panels and stored in batteries. It is transferred automatically through all connected blocks. Many blocks require electricity to function.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Asteroids
data.value: Asteroids can be found in space. How many there are depends on the server or world settings. Most asteroids will have ores that can be mined.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Gravity
data.value: There is gravity on planets. Virtual Gravity can also be produced with the gravity generator block. Virtual gravity has no effect on grids unless virtual mass blocks are implemented.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Oxygen
data.value: Some planets have breathable atmospheres. Oxygen can be produced from ice with a h2/o2 generator or from an oxygen farm. Oxygen can be stored in oxygen tanks and bottles.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Damage
data.value: Damage can be inflicted by using weapons like missile launchers or gatling turrets or hand held rifles. Grids can also be damaged by impacts with other grids or voxels.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Repair
data.value: Use your welder to repair damaged blocks. Blocks that have been completely destroyed need to be replaced or you can use a projector to repair faster.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Welding
data.value: Use your welder on blocks to build and repair. Welding requires power drawn from your suit and components for the block. You can also install welders on ships. Use RMB to add missing components from the block you are looking at to your build planner.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Mining
data.value: You can collect ore by using your drill on voxels like planets or asteroids. Your drill has a short-range detector that shows you the location of ores.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Healing
data.value: You can heal yourself at a medical room or survival kit if you are injured. Hold [{CONTROL:USE}] to use the console.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Recharging
data.value: You can recharge your suit power in medical rooms, survival kits or by sitting in any kind of seat or cockpit as long as it is powered.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Grinding
data.value: You can use a grinder to grind down blocks and deconstruct them. Components are salvaged and transferred into your inventory while grinding.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Hydrogen
data.value: Hydrogen is a fuel used for your suit's jetpack and hydrogen thrusters. Hydrogen is produced from ice in a h2/o2 generator. You can story hydrogen in hydrogen tanks and bottles.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Jetpack
data.value: Your jetpack requires hydrogen. You can produce hydrogen from ice in a h2/o2 generator. Refill bottles at the generator or connect the generator with a medical room or survival kit to recharge your hydrogen directly.

data.name: Description_FAQ_MagneticBoots
data.value: Magnetic boots only work in zero gravity environments. They enable you to stick to surfaces like asteroids or ships. Press [{CONTROL:THRUSTS}] to disable your jetpack and enable your magnetic boots when in a standing position on a surface.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Ore
data.value: Ore refers to several types of minerals that can be refined into ingots using a refinery. Ores can be found on planets and asteroids. Look for dark spots on planets to find ore.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Ice
data.value: Ice is essential to produce oxygen and hydrogen and can be found on planets and inside asteroids.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Voxel
data.value: Voxels are physical bodies such as asteroids or planets. Use your drill to bore into voxels and alter their shape. Use voxel hands in creative mode to create your own shapes.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Grid
data.value: Grids are collections of blocks that shape stations or ships.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Visor
data.value: Your visor can be opened and closed by pressing [{CONTROL:HELMET}]. Don't open your visor in space or you will suffocate!

data.name: Description_FAQ_RoomPressure
data.value: Room pressure is displayed in a vent menu. A room has to be sealed in order to pressurized.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Thrusters
data.value: Thrusters allow your ships to move and fly. Make sure to use the right thrusters in the appropriate environments. Atmospheric thrusters will not work in space!

data.name: Description_FAQ_ShipMovement
data.value: Press [{CONTROL:TOGGLE_REACTORS}] to turn power off and on. If you are wondering if you have enough power, check if there is fuel in your reactors or if your batteries are charged.

data.name: Description_FAQ_RoverMovement
data.value: Press [{CONTROL:LANDING_GEAR}] to disable the brakes and landing gears or [{CONTROL:TOGGLE_REACTORS}] to turn the power off and on. You can check if there is fuel in your reactors or if your batteries are charged.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Planets
data.value: Planets can be seen from any distance. If you do not see planets then they are likely not part of this world.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Pirates
data.value: Protect yourself against pirates and other players by building armor, turrets and decoys.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Fuel
data.value: Reactors use refined uranium ingots for fuel. Your jetpack and hydrogen thrusters require hydrogen.

data.name: Description_FAQ_PCU
data.value: PCU stands for Performance Cost Unit. Building and removing blocks cost and refunds PCU.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Ownership
data.value: You can own blocks when you are the one who added the computer components. You can choose to share your blocks with your faction or anybody else.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Factions
data.value: Factions are a way to play with other players by sharing your blocks, which can be used by other players. Anyone can set up factions.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Bottles
data.value: Hydrogen and oxygen bottles can be produced in assemblers and refilled in h2/o2 generators.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Help
data.value: Press [{CONTROL:HELP_SCREEN}] to find additional help or just ask me.

data.name: Description_FAQ_SaveBlueprints
data.value: You can save ship designs in blueprints by aiming at them and press Ctrl-B. Press F10 to open your menu of blueprints.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Lost
data.value: If you find yourself lost, you can always press [{CONTROL:SUICIDE}] to respawn at your nearest respawn point.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Mass
data.value: Mass indicates the weight of your ship. Filling cargo containers with ores or components can severely impact the performance of your ship.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Skins
data.value: Skins can be found in survival mode by finding the drop pods and activating their buttons. Use a medical room to customize your character.

data.name: Description_FAQ_ShipInventories
data.value: Be sure to connect individual inventories using conveyors. Some items are too large to pass through small conveyor tubes. Press [{CONTROL:INVENTORY}] to open your personal inventory.

data.name: Description_FAQ_ShipBuilding
data.value: The minimum requirements for a ship are a cockpit, gyroscope, one thruster in each direction and some form of power supply, such as a reactor or a battery.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Script
data.value: Scripts might be disabled in world settings.

data.name: Description_FAQ_GridMovement
data.value: Make sure it has thrusters pointing in the direction it is moving and some source of power.

data.name: Description_FAQ_StopMoving
data.value: Be sure to enable your jetpack with [{CONTROL:THRUSTS}] and turn on your dampeners with [{CONTROL:DAMPING}].

data.name: Description_FAQ_RelativeDampeners
data.value: Relative dampeners match your speed and direction with a moving target. Press [Ctrl-{CONTROL:DAMPING}] while looking at your target. You need to be within 100 meters for it to work.

data.name: Description_FAQ_InertiaDampeners
data.value: Inertia dampeners will slow movements when there is no input and can be toggled with [{CONTROL:DAMPING}]. Relative dampeners will match your speed with that of a moving object and can be toggled with [Ctrl-{CONTROL:DAMPING}]. Both need thrusters in all directions to work effectively

data.name: Description_FAQ_Flashlight
data.value: You can toggle your flashlight with [{CONTROL:HEADLIGHTS}]. Flashlights consume suit power and will not work when depleted.

data.name: Description_FAQ_FindOtherPlayers
data.value: Look for factions that allow anyone to join or ask around if you can group up with players. Look for antenna signals that could indicate other players.

data.name: Description_FAQ_HowToPlayGame
data.value: Can you be more specific, please?

data.name: Description_FAQ_Thing
data.value: Have you tried that other thing?

data.name: Description_FAQ_ShipWontFly
data.value: Does your ship have enough power? Does it have enough thrusters? Are your dampeners turned on?

data.name: Description_FAQ_WhatIsABlock
data.value: Blocks are what all ships and stations are made off. There are two sizes: large and small. You can find blocks in the menu by pressing [{CONTROL:BUILD_SCREEN}].

data.name: Description_FAQ_MirrorMode
data.value: Mirror mode only works in creative mode and allows symmetric building. Press [{CONTROL:SYMMETRY_SWITCH}] to cycle through all six planes of mirrors. Use LMB button to confirm placement and RMB to remove one. Press [{CONTROL:USE_SYMMETRY}] to temporarily disable mirror mode.

data.name: Description_FAQ_ProtectingMyself
data.value: Hide your bases underground or inside asteroids. Build turrets and decoys to defend against attacks. Build hidden medical rooms and spread them out to maintain ways to respawn when attacked from inside you base.

data.name: Description_FAQ_LosingHealth
data.value: Are you suffocating? Standing in front of a thruster or perhaps you came too close to an active ship tool?

data.name: Description_FAQ_VoxelHands
data.value: Voxel hands is a tool only available in creative mode, which allows you to add and sculpt voxel shapes. It can be enabled in world settings. press K to open voxel hand menu while equiped.

data.name: Description_FAQ_AirTightnessPressure
data.value: A room needs to be airtight before it can be filled with oxygen by an air vent. Make sure there are no holes exposed to space and that all doors are closed.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Components
data.value: Components are required to construct blocks. They can be produced in assemblers from ingots. Placing a block in survival mode always requires the first component.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Station
data.value: A station is a grid that is static and directly attached to voxels like planets or asteroids. Some stations can fly, but only have enough thrusters for basic movement.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Ship
data.value: A ship is a grid that is designed to move. It has thrusters in each direction, a gyroscope for orientation, a cockpit and some source of power like batteries or reactors. Ships can be designed for specific tasks like building or fighting.

data.name: Description_FAQ_CarRover
data.value: A rover is a vehicle that uses wheels to move instead of thrusters, which are used to fly. Rovers are usually cheap to build, but often slow and an easy target for other players.

data.name: Description_FAQ_GPSSignals
data.value: GPS signals can be disabled or created in the Coms tab. Double-click a GPS signal to disable it. GPS signals can be stored in LCD panels or broadcasted in chat. Be careful not to attract enemies.

data.name: Description_FAQ_GridSize
data.value: There are 2 grid sizes available that are simply referred to as small and large. You can switch the grid size of a block by reselecting the same block on your toolbar. Not all blocks are available in both grid sizes.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Suit
data.value: Your suit keeps you alive when you are in space. Your health, hydrogen, oxygen and power supplies are displayed on your HUD. Your suit is equipped with magnetic boots to walk in space and a jetpack to fly.

data.name: Description_FAQ_HandTools
data.value: There are 3 hand tools. A welder builds and repairs. A grinder salvages and deconstructs, while a drill is used to find ore, collect ore and dig tunnels.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Inventory
data.value: Your inventory can be accessed by pressing [{CONTROL:INVENTORY}]. Drag items outside of your inventory screen to drop them. Pick up items by pressing [{CONTROL:PICK_UP}].

data.name: Description_FAQ_ShipToolsWeapons
data.value: Tools can be added to your toolbars by pressing [{CONTROL:BUILD_SCREEN}]. Drag and drop or right-click tools to automatically add them to your toolbar. This works the same for ship functions when you are inside a cockpit.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Ingots
data.value: Ingots are produced in refineries from ores and are essential to produce components.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Armor
data.value: Armor is used to design the structure of ships and stations, and acts as protection for important blocks. Light armor is cheap and enables ships to be fast. Heavy armor offers more protection for ships, but it affects these vehicles' speed.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Meteor
data.value: Meteors can be enabled in world settings. You can protect yourself against meteors by building gatling turrets, adding layers of armor to vehicles and buildings or by simply hiding inside structures.

data.name: Description_FAQ_UnknownSignals
data.value: Signals indicate positions of pods where you can obtain loot and skins in survival mode. Weak signals are only visible for you. Stronger signals are visible for everyone on the server but may lead to better loot.

data.name: Description_FAQ_GPSColors
data.value: Blue Signals are owned by you. White signals are owned by a friendly faction. Red signals are owned by a hostile faction. Green and yellow signals indicate loot pods.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Drones
data.value: Drones are small unmanned ships that can either be remote controlled, script controlled or sometimes controlled by sensors and timer blocks.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Objective
data.value: Space Engineers is a sandbox game. You can set your own goals. Search the workshop for scenarios and missions or create your own to play together with friends! Active mission objectives are displayed in the top left corner.

data.name: Description_FAQ_GoodBot
data.value: I am Good.bot. I am here to answer your questions to the best of my ability. How can I help you?

data.name: Description_FAQ_Math
data.value: Math! I do that all the time!

data.name: Description_FAQ_Begin
data.value: Get your production up and running. Build refineries and assemblers. Make sure you have enough power, Build solar panels, batteries and reactors. make sure your medical room is well protected and build more to be sure!

data.name: Description_FAQ_BasicMovement
data.value: Use [{CONTROL:FORWARD}] [{CONTROL:STRAFE_LEFT}] [{CONTROL:BACKWARD}] [{CONTROL:STRAFE_RIGHT}] to move, Hold [{CONTROL:SPRINT}] to sprint, Toggle [{CONTROL:SWITCH_WALK}] to walk. Use [{CONTROL:CROUCH}] to crouch and [{CONTROL:JUMP}] to jump.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Time
data.value: It is time for Space Engineers!

data.name: Description_FAQ_SteamWorkshop
data.value: The Steam workshop is where you can find all player made blueprints, scenarios, scripts and mods that players published. Subscribe to workshop items to access them in game.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Painting
data.value: While holding a block, you can paint blocks with [{CONTROL:CUBE_COLOR_CHANGE}]. Press K to access more colour options. Use Ctrl-[{CONTROL:CUBE_COLOR_CHANGE}] or Shift-[{CONTROL:CUBE_COLOR_CHANGE}] to paint large surfaces.

data.name: Description_FAQ_InvalidMaterial
data.value: Sorry, That material does not exist in Space Engineers.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Broadcasting
data.value: Your suit has a limited range antenna for accessing grids remotely or controlling drones. You can turn it off and on with O.

data.name: Description_FAQ_BlockRotation
data.value: You can turn on the block and grid rotations assist in the game options menu to see the rotation controls. Press [{CONTROL:CUBE_DEFAULT_MOUNTPOINT}] to rotate a block towards its default mount-point.

data.name: Description_FAQ_HUD
data.value: You can switch between HUD states with [{CONTROL:TOGGLE_HUD}]. Toggle [{CONTROL:TOGGLE_SIGNALS}] to switch between modes for GPS signals.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Bug
data.value: You can report bugs and problems with the game at the forums or visit https://support.keenswh.com/

data.name: Description_FAQ_Messages
data.value: You can send private messages to other players or factions through the Coms tab in your inventory. These messages can only be send if your antenna is enabled and in range of other players or antennas.

data.name: Description_FAQ_AutoPilot
data.value: To use autopilot your ship first needs a Remote Control block. You need to add custom GPS waypoints in the Remote Control Block and select a flight mode. You can also set actions to happen when the ship arrives at the next waypoint.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Experimental
data.value: Experimental mode is a setting that enables features that are considered unstable and can possibly cause performance issues. Experimental mode can be enabled in game settings.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Marek
data.value: Marek Rosa is the Founder and CEO of Keen Software House and GoodAI.

data.name: Description_FAQ_GoodAI
data.value: GoodAI was founded by CEO/CTO Marek Rosa in January 2014 and performs research on the development of artificial intelligence.

data.name: Description_FAQ_DisableHints
data.value: To disable Good.bot hints, press Escape, go to Options, go to Game and disable "Show Good.bot hints".

data.name: Description_FAQ_Permissions
data.value: In multiplayer you need special permissions from an admin to be able to spawn blueprints, edit scripts or teleport. In single player you can turn on space master or change the world mode to creative.

data.name: Description_FAQ_LeavePlanet
data.value: To leave a planet with an atmosphere you need a ship capable of going into space. The best way is to equip your ship with hydrogen thrusters and hydrogen tanks.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Groups
data.value: You can use block functions of multiple blocks simultaneously by using block groups. Use Ctrl or Shift to select the ship blocks you wish to put into a group; enter a name in "Block group" on the right side of the screen and press Enter to create the block group.

data.name: Description_FAQ_MergeGrids
data.value: You can connect grids with each other with landing gears or connectors. You can merge two grids of the same size type together permanently by using merge blocks or even rotors.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Camera
data.value: You can change your perspective with [{CONTROL:CAMERA_MODE}] from first person mode to third person mode. Note that third person camera can clip back to first person if objects are obstructing the view.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Ammo
data.value: You can create ammunition for your weapons and turrets in the advanced assembler if you have the right materials available.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Airlock
data.value: An airlock permits the player to move freely in and out while keeping the interior pressurized. The easiest way to achieve this is by building a set of parallel doors but can be made much more advanced with air vents, timer blocks, button panels or scripts.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Pushing
data.value: Player characters can push small grids by walking or flying into them if these grids aren't too heavy. If you want to push or pull heavy objects you will have to build a ship or rover and grab the object with landing gear.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Upgrade
data.value: You can assemble better tools in the assembler. You can also upgrade the refinery and assembler by adding upgrade modules to make them faster, more efficient or less power consuming.

data.name: Description_FAQ_GameMode
data.value: There are two game modes: survival and creative. In creative mode you won't need any materials to build your ships. You can change this game mode by selecting your world in your saves menu and change the settings.

data.name: Description_FAQ_ScreenShot
data.value: You can make screenshots by pressing F12 by default. Or if you have Nividea Ansel you can press Alt-F to enter capture mode.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Unlock
data.value: You can unlock new blocks by fully constructing other required blocks. You can see what blocks will unlock the next block by viewing them in the G screen.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Temperature
data.value: Temperature affects your suit systems and will drain your power faster in extreme conditions. Without power your suit will no longer protect you against extreme conditions and you may start taking damage.

data.name: Description_FAQ_SpawnShip
data.value: Your spawn ship will have everything you need to get started. A survival kit, power and a h2/o2 generator for oxygen and hydrogen. You can take nonesential parts of your ship to use for your new base and scrap it entirely once you no longer need it.

data.name: Description_FAQ_MetalScrap
data.value: Metal scrap appears when blocks are violently destroyed and can be melted back into iron ingots by putting them into a refinery.

data.name: Description_FAQ_LogOut
data.value: You can use a cryo room to store your character before leaving the server. This will prevent your character from dying after some time and losing your toolbar. Make sure the room is supplied with oxygen and power.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Interaction
data.value: Interactible objects like doors, cockpits and button panels are higlighted yellow and can be entered or interacted with by pressing [{CONTROL:USE}].

data.name: Description_FAQ_Navigation
data.value: You can create GPS signals to store important locations and waypoints. Use an antenna or beacon to broadcast positions of grids, but be careful, as others can also see these marked locations. Use /GPS to quickly save your current location.

data.name: Description_FAQ_CopyPaste
data.value: You can copy, paste and delete blocks and grids only in creative mode by pressing Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V and Ctrl-X.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Tools
data.value: A welder to construct blocks, a grinder to deconstruct blocks and a drill to find ore and dig tunnels. All tools can be produced in assemblers or survival kits from basic materials.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Commands
data.value: Use /help to find all chat comands.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Platinum
data.value: Platinum is a rare material only found in asteroids and moons. There is no platinum on planets.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Uranium
data.value: Uranium is a rare material only found in asteroids and moons. There is no uranium on planets.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Stone
data.value: Stone can be refined into small amounts of basic minerals like Iron, Silicon and Nickel in refineries or a survival kit.

data.name: Description_FAQ_BlockShapes
data.value: You can access alternative block shapes if you have a block equipped on your toolbar with an + symbol. Use the scroll wheel to switch to different shapes.

data.name: Description_FAQ_BuildMode
data.value: You can toggle different building modes by pressing B.

data.name: Description_FAQ_CarJump
data.value: Your car can use its suspensions to jump to get out of tight spaces. Hold and release X to charge the jump of your car. The strength of the jump is based on your suspensions strength setting.

data.name: Description_FAQ_ConvertGrid
data.value: You can convert grids from station to ship or ship into station in a grid's info screen if this is enabled in the world settings.

data.name: Description_FAQ_FlipRover
data.value: You can flip your rover by adding pistons and pushing itself up or you can try adding heavy blocks like batteries to your grid, so that it will fall over by changing its center of mass.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Tutorial
data.value: Play "Learning to Survive" to learn about the basics of Space Engineers. Pay attention to the tooltips for blocks to learn about their functions and I will do my best to help you along the way!

data.name: Description_FAQ_Encounter
data.value: Random encounters are shipwrecks, derelict vessels and pirate stations that can be found in space. They often broadcast a MAYDAY signal. Careful, exploring these encounters can be dangerous.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Blastdoors
data.value: Blast door blocks are armor blocks that won't bend and fit in between layers of blocks, so they can move freely by rotors or pistons. They are useful to create large moving doors and platforms.

data.name: Description_FAQ_BlockLimit
data.value: Block limits sets a limit to how many of each type of block each player can build to ensure server performance. Block limits can be disabled in the world settings.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Hacking
data.value: Hacking a block can be done by using a grinder to remove the computer components from a block and placing them back with a welder to gain acces to the block.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Ladder
data.value: You can use ladders to traverse vertical spaces. Ladders can be stacked vertically. Press [{CONTROL:USE}] to interact with a ladder. Hold [{CONTROL:FORWARD}] or [{CONTROL:BACKWARD}] to go up and down. Press [{CONTROL:JUMP}] to get off the ladder.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Decoratives
data.value: Decorative blocks allow players to decorate the interiors of large grid ships. Blocks such as the desk and kitchen are modular and can be combined together to create many shapes.

data.name: Description_FAQ_IndustrialCockpit
data.value: The industrial cockpit is a sturdy decorative cockpit for large and small grids that features a large field of vision. This cockpit is usefull for rovers and ships that need to work close to surfaces or other grids without damaging them.

data.name: Description_FAQ_ConsoleBlock
data.value: The console block is a decorative block with the abillity to project large and small grids scaled down.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Emotes
data.value: Emotes are character animations that can be equipped on your toolbar from the G-screen or played by opening chat and entering / followed by the name of the emote you wish to play. for example: /EmoteName

data.name: Description_FAQ_BuildPlanner
data.value: The build planner helps you to quickly access the components required to build blocks. Use your welders RMB function to add a block to your component list. Use the withdraw button from any inventories to automatically collect the required components if available and accessible.

data.name: Description_FAQ_StylePack
data.value: The Style Pack ads more player skins, armor skins and emotes for you to use in game.

data.name: Description_FAQ_ArmorSkins
data.value: Armor skins are different textures and patterns for your ships and stations. They can be applied the same way you paint grids. Press P to open the paint screen.

data.name: Description_FAQ_NPCShip
data.value: There are cargo ships that travel the world around you. Coming near them can be dangerous as they consider you a threat.

data.name: Description_FAQ_CooperativeMode
data.value: Cooperative mode will let assemblers automatically take a portion of the queue of another assembler, making them work together.

data.name: Description_FAQ_SpectatorMode
data.value: You can access Spectator mode by pressing F8 to move around your camera freely and F7 to remain in the spectator camera while controlling your character. Spectator mode requires permissions and has to enabled in worlds settings.

data.name: IngameHelp_BuildingTip2_Detail1
data.value: Are you sure you have not done this before?

data.name: IngameHelp_BuildingTip2_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Always make sure you keep a few components with you.

data.name: IngameHelp_FlyingAShipLGTip_Detail1
data.value: One Engineer told me that flying a ship is as easy as riding a bike!

data.name: IngameHelp_FlyingAShipLGTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Landing gears can be used to pick up other grids and move them around.

data.name: IngameHelp_FlyingAShipLG_Detail1
data.value: This ship is equipped with magnetic landing gears. Toggling landing gears will temporarily disable their magnetic lock.

data.name: IngameHelp_FlyingAShipLG_Detail2
data.value: Use {0} to toggle the landing gear.

data.name: IngameHelp_WheeledVehicles2_Detail1
data.value: You can adjust wheel settings individually to control steering angles, acceleration, maximum speed and much more. They can “jump” by charging their suspension to get out of gaps.

data.name: IngameHelp_WheeledVehicles2_Detail2
data.value: Hold and release {0} to charge a jump.

data.name: IngameHelp_WheeledVehiclesTip_Detail1
data.value: Congratulations! You just passed your driving test!

data.name: IngameHelp_WheeledVehiclesTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Be careful not to go too fast with Wheeled Vehicles, which can flip over easily.

data.name: IngameHelp_WheeledVehicles_Detail1
data.value: Wheeled Vehicles are cheap to build and require little power.

data.name: IngameHelp_WheeledVehicles_Detail2
data.value: Toggle {0} to turn power off and on.

data.name: IngameHelp_OwnershipTip_Detail1
data.value: To hack or not to hack? That is the real question!

data.name: IngameHelp_OwnershipTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* You can configure ownership to share it with friends. Remember, you can find additional information anytime in the help screen by pressing {0}.

data.name: IngameHelp_HelmetVisorTip_Detail1
data.value: Being able to breathe makes working a little easier.

data.name: IngameHelp_HelmetVisorTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Always make sure your visor is closed before going into space. All of this useful information can always be accessed in the help screen by pressing {0}.

data.name: IngameHelp_HelmetVisor_Detail1
data.value: Your helmet visor is still open! Close it to avoid taking damage in low oxygen environments.

data.name: IngameHelp_HelmetVisor_Detail2
data.value: Use {0} to open and close your visor.

data.name: IngameHelp_StuckTip_Detail1
data.value: Excellent! Now you can continue your training.

data.name: IngameHelp_StuckTip_Detail2
data.value: *Tip:* Always make sure your vehicle has enough fuel before leaving your base.

data.name: IngameHelp_Stuck_Detail2
data.value: Press {0} to toggle power on and off.

data.name: IngameHelp_Stuck_Detail3
data.value: Press {0} to toggle landing gears, brakes and connectors.

data.name: IngameHelp_IntroTip2_Detail1
data.value: *Tip:* You can enable/disable Good.bot ingame help or control hints in Game-Options.

data.name: NotificationJumpAbortedAlreadyJumping
data.value: Jump was aborted, connected grid is already jumping.

data.name: NotificationJumpAbortedLocked
data.value: Jump was aborted, the grid is locked.

data.name: NotificationJumpAbortedNoLocation
data.value: Jump was aborted, no suitable target location found.

data.name: NotificationJumpAbortedShortDistance
data.value: Jump was aborted, distance too short.

data.name: NotificationJumpAbortedStatic
data.value: Jump was aborted, the grid is static.

data.name: MedicalRoom_SpawnNameToolTip
data.value: The name to display on the spawn screen. Leave empty to display the block name.

data.name: SurvivalKit_SpawnNameToolTip
data.value: The name to display on the spawn screen. Leave empty to display the block name.

data.name: Antenna_HudTextToolTip
data.value: The text to display on the HUD when the antenna is enabled. Leave empty to display the block name.

data.name: BlockPropertiesTitle_HudText_Tooltip
data.value: The text to display on the HUD when the beacon is enabled. Leave empty to display the block name.

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettings_EnableResearch
data.value: Enables advancement through a progression tree

data.name: NotificationBlockNotResearched
data.value: Unknown technology. You have to research it first.

data.name: IngameHelp_Pod1_Detail1
data.value: You start in small drop pod containing the most important accessories. The pod is equipped with an h2/o2 generator to produce hydrogen and oxygen and a survival kit for health and energy.

data.name: IngameHelp_Pod2_Detail1
data.value: The survival kit, if powered, will let you respawn, regenerate your health and energy and is capable of producing small amounts of ingots from stone that you can then produce into components.

data.name: IngameHelp_Pod3_Detail1
data.value: The first thing to do is to gather stone using your hand drill. Equip your drill, find some stone and store it in the survival kit on the back of your pod. Then access the production tab of your pod and produce ingots.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_KeepOriginalOwnershipOnPasteTip
data.value: When grid is pasted keep original ownership and authorship.

data.name: TerminalTab_Factions_ShareProgressToolTip
data.value: Share your block unlock progress with selected member.

data.name: IngameHelp_Turbine2_Detail1
data.value: Your base will require more power as you add more functional blocks. Be sure to build more wind turbines or solar panels or turn blocks off to prevent them from consuming power.

data.name: IngameHelp_Turbine_Detail1
data.value: A solar panel or wind turbine under the right conditions will be able to provide enough energy for you to get started. Continue by adding a basic assembler or deconstruct your old survival kit and move it over to your new base.

data.name: IngameHelp_BasicRefinery_Detail1
data.value:
A basic assembler or basic refinery is more efficient at producing and refining then the survival kit but also requires more power.
Build a battery to use your power more efficiently.

data.name: IngameHelp_Battery2_Detail1
data.value: You can find ores by looking for dark or bright spots on the ground. Equip your drill to scan for nearby ores or build scouting vehicles with ore detectors to move large amounts of ore to your base.

data.name: IngameHelp_Battery_Detail1
data.value:
Your base is shaping up!
Now that you have a battery you can start expanding your base even more. Try to find ores to increase your production significantly.

data.name: IngameHelp_Temperature_Detail1
data.value:
Temperature affects how quickly your suit energy drains. Hot or cold temperatures will hurt you when your suit is out of power.
Tip: Pressurized environments will always maintain optimal temperatures.

data.name: RespawnScreeenHelpTextSpaceSpawn
data.value: You will spawn near other players in space.

data.name: RespawnScreeenHelpTextSpawn
data.value: You will spawn near other players on the planet or the moon.

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettings_BlocksInventorySize
data.value: Adjust inventory size of the blocks

data.name: BlockPropertyDescription_Connector_AutoUnlockTime
data.value: Time (in seconds) after which connector automatically unlocks.

data.name: Terminal_Trading_Tooltip
data.value: Trading mode allows trading through store block. Blocks visibility of blocks of other grid, transfer of electricity and items. Cannot be changed while connector is connected.

data.name: Beacon_SafeZone_ToolTip
data.value:
Toggle to turn on safe zone (Grid has to be converted to station for this to work).
Activation time is {0} second{3}. Cost is {1} Zone Chip{4} per {2} minute{5}.

data.name: Beacon_SafeZone_RangeSlider_TTIP
data.value: Change to set new safe zone range

data.name: Beacon_SafeZone_AllowVoxel_TTIP
data.value: Allow/Disallow Voxel modifications in Safe Zone

data.name: Beacon_SafeZone_AllowConvertToStation_TTIP
data.value: Select to allow converting large grids to stations inside the safe zone.

data.name: Beacon_SafeZone_AllowLandingGear_TTIP
data.value: Select to allow landing gear locking inside the safe zone

data.name: FactionTerminal_Deposit_Currency_TTIP
data.value: Deposit to faction account from personal account

data.name: FactionTerminal_Withdraw_Currency_TTIP
data.value: Withdraw from faction account to personal account

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_ReloadWorldClient_Tooltip
data.value: You cannot reload the world if you are not the host.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_AddCharacter_Tooltip
data.value: Adds a new controllable character to the world.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_RemoveCharacter_Tooltip
data.value: Removes the currently active character from the world.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_DeleteRecordings_Confirm
data.value: Please confirm you wish to delete the stored recordings.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_Replay_Tooltip
data.value: Starts playing back all stored data.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_RecordAndReplay_Tooltip
data.value: Starts replay of stored data, as well as begins recording data for the current selected character.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_ChangeAsset_Tooltip
data.value: Change the skin for the currently selected character.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_StopRecording_Tooltip
data.value: Stops recording for the currently selected character.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_ReplayTool_Tutorial
data.value:
How to use the Replay Tool: 1. Add as many characters as you need, then position them how you want them and save the world. 2. Switch to the character you wish to control using F6. 3. Click 'Record + Replay', and move the character as you wish. 4. Press escape to stop recording. 5. Reload the world, do not save!. 6. Repeat from step 2.
If you wish to clear the recorded data, press Delete Recordings to start over.
If you wish to observe the recorded data, press 'Replay' and watch as the game replays the data.
If you wish to store the recorded data, reload the world, then save the game. Then, it will carry over to other sessions.

data.name: DisplayName_InventoryConstraint_PersonalItems
data.value: Tools, Weapons, Ammo, and personal items

data.name: ToolTipTerminalInventory_AddComponents
data.value:
Add components from Build Planner to production queue
Shortcuts for conveyor port interaction: Shift+{0} - Add components to production Shift+Ctrl+{0} - Add components to production 10x

data.name: ToolTipTerminalInventory_AddSelectedComponent
data.value: Add selected component to production queue

data.name: ToolTipTerminalInventory_Deposit
data.value:
Deposit all ores, ingots and components
Shortcuts for conveyor port interaction: Alt+{0} - Deposit all ores, ingots and components

data.name: ToolTipTerminalInventory_Withdraw
data.value:
Withdraw components for Build Planner Hold Ctrl for x10 amount.

data.name: BuildPlanner_Description
data.value: Build Planner helps you to manage required components for your build. It also helps you with grabbing them from inventories or queueing for production.

data.name: Terminal_Factions_Unknown_Label_TTIP
data.value: Faction not discovered. Data is not available.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Builder
data.value: Come and browse our selection of the finest ships available to us. We deliver top quality ships made from the highest grade materials.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Miner
data.value: No. 1 supplier of high grade minerals and gases. Everything to fuel your industrial advancements.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Trader
data.value: If you can build with it, we sell it. If you can shoot with it, we sell that too.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Builder0
data.value: The best choice for reliable ships of industrial grade. We offer the finest quality money can buy.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Builder1
data.value: Top manufacturer of ships for the best prices. We offer excellent service that fit your needs.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Builder2
data.value: Reliable, durable, Safe. These words mark our selection of our terrestrial and extraterrestrial vehicles.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Builder3
data.value: Cutting edge technologies bring you the best quality through our shipyards, delivering competitive advantage to you over your competitors.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Builder4
data.value: Number one producer of vehicles for industrial, military, mining and exploration aplications.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Miner0
data.value: For the highest grade of minerals and gases come visit us.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Miner1
data.value: We procure all manner of ores and gases, so you don't have to.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Miner2
data.value: Finest ore and purest gases. Nothing but the best for our customers.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Miner3
data.value: We offer every raw material the galaxy has to offer. Except water. No one can seem to find water.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Miner4
data.value: Our industrial equipment and trained personnel bring you the finest quality ores and gases for the best prices.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Trader0
data.value: You want it, we've got it. Top supplier of components, tools and gases.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Trader1
data.value: Our partners deliver us the highest quality components, tools, gases and contracts. From the outer regions of space directly to you.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Trader2
data.value: We deliver durable components and the best quality tools. Our services include fuel, oxygen and contracts from reliable partners.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Trader3
data.value: Components, Munitions, Tools, and Fuel. You name it. Become a partner for the best offers, we will make it worth your while.

data.name: EconomyFaction_Description_Trader4
data.value: We offer all the essentials for your space industrial advancements and more.

data.name: IngameHelp_EconomyStation_Desc
data.value: Economy Stations can appear anywhere in space, on moons, planets and in orbit. These stations offer trade and contracts depending on their respective factions.

data.name: StoreBuy_Error_Text_SpawnFailed

data.name: Contracts_Accepted_Text
data.value: By accepting this contract you are bound to fulfill all conditions of this contract in timely manner. Failing to do so may lead to negative feedback and loss of assets.

data.name: Contracts_Completed_Text
ContractScreen_Deliver_Description_0
data.value: A priority package is to be delivered to a client of us and we are looking for the right person for the job. You will pay a mandatory collateral upon accepting this contract. Failing to complete the contract within the time limit will result our client being quite unpleased with our services and your collateral will be lost. We are sure you are up to the task.

data.name: ContractScreen_Escort_Description_0
data.value: One of our cargo ship operators reported potential threats and is unable to proceed. We are in need of a pilot with the right equipment to escort this cargo ship safely until the treat has subsided. You will be paid appropriately. Are you up for the job?

data.name: ContractScreen_Find_Description_0
data.value: A container got lost during transit and a client of ours is eager to see it returned. Go to it's last known location and find this container.

data.name: ContractScreen_Hunt_Description_0
data.value: With the absence of organized law enforcement the responsibility falls to individual factions to make sure that criminals do not go unpunished. With that said, we have received reports of the location of one such culprit and we need you to make an example of them, so that others are not tempted down the same path. Find and take the target down. Use hand-held weapons or tools for the full reward. You will be kept up to date of the latest reported position of your target.

data.name: ContractScreen_ObtainDeliver_Description_0
data.value: A client of ours has requested some specific goods they wish delivered to this station for pickup. Obtain the goods and then deliver them to us. We will ensure you are adequately rewarded.

data.name: StoreBuy_Error_Text_NotEnoughAmount
data.value: There is not enough amount of the item.

data.name: StoreBuy_Error_Text_NotEnoughStoreBlockInventorySpace
data.value: There is not enough space in the store block inventory to complete transaction.

data.name: Contracts_Error_Text_FinishCondition_NotEnoughSpace
data.value: Contract could not be finished. There is not enough space for transfered items.

data.name: ContractScreen_Deliver_Description_1
data.value: A partnered station has not been able to supply one of its customers due to a shortage. They have requested that we will fill the gap and deliver the order as soon as possible. Accepting this contract will require collateral and said collateral will be forfeit if you fail to complete the assignment in time.

data.name: ContractScreen_Deliver_Description_2
data.value: We are looking for skilled couriers capable of handling jobs within a tight schedule. We require a mandatory collateral upon accepting this contract. You will be reimbursed and rewarded upon completing the contract but failing to do so will forfeit the collateral. Time is key, are you up for it?

data.name: ContractScreen_Escort_Description_1
data.value: A nearby transport requested assistance after detecting hostile activity in it's vicinity. Go to the transport and make sure it gets through in one piece. Your feats will dictate your compensation.

data.name: ContractScreen_Escort_Description_2
data.value: It looks like one of our competitors decided to resort to less conventional ways to beat the competition. Report to our cargo ship and keep it safe. Let them know we mean business. You will be rewarded based on your performance.

data.name: ContractScreen_Find_Description_1
data.value: Due to a navigational error a cargo capsule was misdelivered and we only know it's rough whereabouts. We need someone capable of finding it before someone else does. Are you up for it?

data.name: ContractScreen_Find_Description_2
data.value: We need someone to pick up a discreet package whose exact position is unknown. Locate this package for us and there will be a reward for you.

data.name: ContractScreen_Hunt_Description_1
data.value: It seems like someone has made a bit of a name for themselves at the expense of others and in doing so made some of our clients quite unhappy. We just received reports detailing this person's last known position. We will happily compensate you if you can track them down and take them out. To ensure proper identification of your target we would prefer you take them down with either weapons or hand tools, if you prefer. You will be more highly rewarded for doing so. We will make sure you are updated with the last known location of the target. Are you up to the job?

data.name: ContractScreen_Hunt_Description_2
data.value: Someone has been causing a lot of trouble lately and we need someone who isn't afraid to deal with it. We will relay the target's last known position to you. Go there, find the troublemaker, and take them out. You will receive the full reward if the contract is completed by means of hand-held weaponry.

data.name: ContractScreen_ObtainDeliver_Description_1
data.value: This station is in need of maintenance but we are in short supply. Get us the required materials and you will be paid in full.

data.name: ContractScreen_ObtainDeliver_Description_2
data.value: As a result of a miscommunication with a distributor we find ourselves short on some supplies. Find us these supplies, bring them here and you will be compensated for your services.

data.name: StoreSell_Error_Text_NotEnoughMoney
data.value: The owner of this store does not have enough money.

data.name: StoreSell_Error_Text_NotEnoughInventorySpace
data.value: There is not enough space in store's grid inventories.

data.name: ReputationBat_Tooltip_Friendly
data.value: Friendly relation From {0} to {1} reputation. Able to interact. Bonus deals. {2}% discount (up to {4}%), {3}% sell bonus (up to {5}%).

data.name: ReputationBat_Tooltip_Hostile
data.value: Hostile relation From {0} to {1} reputation. Unable to interact, attacked on sight.

data.name: ReputationBat_Tooltip_Neutral
data.value: Neutral relation From {0} to {1} reputation. Able to interact.

data.name: ContractScreen_Escort_Description_3
data.value: One of our transports is experiencing technical difficulties and some vultures seemed to have taken notice. Go out there and protect the transport. Make them think twice. You will be rewarded based on how well you performed.

data.name: ContractScreen_ObtainDeliver_Description_3
data.value: Some of our stock has not been able to keep up with demand. Help us resupply and you will be paid a fair price.

data.name: ContractScreen_ObtainDeliver_Description_4
data.value: We have several buyers interested in products not currently available to us. Help find these products and you will receive a sizeable cut.

data.name: ContractScreen_ObtainDeliver_Description_5
data.value: These commodities have been in high demand lately and we are running low. Interested in helping out? You will be adequately compensated.

data.name: Datapad_Station_GPS_Content_0
data.value: I happen to know a guy who knows a guy with some good deals. The real quality stuff you know? But it doesn't look like I will be getting anywhere near this place to profit from these deals so I will sell you the data if you are interested.

data.name: Datapad_Station_GPS_Content_1
data.value: A friend of mine who works on a remote station called in saying he has some contracts ready. They pay a good amount so if you are looking for a job then that's the place to go. Good luck!

data.name: Datapad_Station_GPS_Content_2
data.value: So you are looking for more jobs or trade? Sure we can sort you out. Take a look at this place. It is a bit remote but rumor goes that pilots find good opportunities here.

data.name: Datapad_Station_GPS_Content_3
data.value: Some conflict between two factions left a field of debris and salvager are plucking the fruits by selling their findings to a nearby station that now has their stocks overflowing. If you are looking for good deals or work then this is the place to go.

data.name: Datapad_Station_GPS_Content_4
data.value: There is plenty of work available if you know where to look. You should investigate this place, I heard there is a shortage on couriers.

data.name: Datapad_Station_GPS_Content_5
data.value: Some Merchant keeps bragging about some really good deals at a station he has been visiting but would not spill the details. However, I happened to "stumble" on his navigation computer during my maintenance shift and this position kept popping up. Go see if there is any truth in what that merchant said.

data.name: Datapad_Station_GPS_Content_6
data.value: I used to visit this place at a regular basis during my engineering days and they always had some good deals available. Go see if they are still at it.

data.name: Datapad_Station_GPS_Content_7
data.value: A station lost some its client's due to some conflict of interest between factions and is now looking for new hires. Interested? This is where you should go.

data.name: Datapad_Station_GPS_Content_8
data.value: Looking for Reliable contracts? Good trades? Or just making good money? You are in luck! Opportunity awaits at these coordinates!

data.name: IngameHelp_Economy_GPSDesc
data.value: This is location of the nearest trading station, where you can buy/sell various items.

data.name: ToolTipWorldSettingsBountyContracts
data.value: If enabled bounty contracts will be available on stations

data.name: Economy_FactionIcon_Tooltip_BuyEconomy
data.value: Buy Economy DLC to unlock these faction icons

data.name: IngameHelp_Datapad_Desc
data.value: I can see you have a datapad in your inventory. Datapad can hold important information you wish to store there. For example, datapad bought on stations contain coordinates of other stations.

data.name: ContractScreen_Repair_Description_0
data.value: Our equipment has sustained serious damage as result of a recent meteor shower and is in need of repairs. Go out there and make sure all is back in working order.

data.name: ContractScreen_Repair_Description_1
data.value: We lost contact with our equipment recently. Check and repair any damage you can find and you will be well endorsed.

data.name: ContractScreen_Repair_Description_2
data.value: Scavengers have been targeting our equipment lately. Check our equipment for damage and return it to top condition.

data.name: ContractScreen_Administration_SelectionText_Repair
data.value: Select the grid that shall be rapaired in this contract

data.name: ContractScreen_Repair_Description_3
data.value: A navigation error resulted into a cargo ship colliding with our equipment. Check for damage and repair any that you can find. You will be compensated for the components.

data.name: ContractScreen_Repair_Description_4
data.value: We would like to recommission some of our equipment but it is in no functional condition right now. Check out what is missing or damaged, fix it and you will be paid for the components.

data.name: ContractScreen_Repair_Description_5
data.value: Our Equipment needs inspection. Find it, perform a full checkup and repair any damage you can find.

data.name: SafeZone_Color_TTP
data.value: Changes color of the safe zone sphere.

data.name: ContractScreen_Find_Description_3
data.value: A client of us listed a reward for the one who can retrieve a lost drop pod in time. A fast vehicle and keen eye is recommended.

data.name: ContractScreen_Find_Description_4
data.value: A courier dropped a transport container to distract his pursuers. It did not work but we are interested in seeing it's contents returned. Locate this container and mark it for pickup.

data.name: SafeZone_Texture_DLCReq_TTIP
data.value: Economy DLC Required. Changes texture of safe zone.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_IgnoreSafeZonesTip
data.value: When enabled you will be completely immune to the effects of safezone. WARNING: This affects only your characters. Grids will still be affected.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_AddReputation_ReputationPropagate_Tooltip
data.value: Propagate reputation to friends and enemies of faction. Warning: Propagation of positive and negative reputation is not symmetric. Propagating 1000 and then -1000 won't have zero sum for friends and foes of the faction.

data.name: TerminalSafeZoneNeedsStation
data.value: Safe zones can be enabled only on stations.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_IgnorePcuTip
data.value: When enabled, you will completely ignore all PCU limits. This may cause you to go into negative PCUs.

data.name: Trash_KickAFKWarning
data.value: Please note: If you remain inactive for 1 minute you will be disconnected.

data.name: Economy_CantRemoveStation_Text
data.value: Economy stations are handled by Economy system. You may not remove them.

data.name: Description_Datapad
data.value: A datapad is an electronic device used to store and display information.

data.name: Description_Medkit
data.value: A medkit is a case containing medical supplies for healing astronaut.

data.name: Description_Package
data.value: A package is a box used for storing items for Hauling contract.

data.name: Description_Powerkit
data.value: A powerkit is a portable battery pack for recharging suit of an astronaut.

data.name: Description_SpaceCredit
data.value: A Space Credit is a currency used for trading.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_AddCurrency_Player_Tooltip
data.value: Player or faction whose currency will be modified.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_AddReputation_Faction_Tooltip
data.value: Faction whose relation will be modified.

data.name: ScreenDebugAdminMenu_AddReputation_Player_Tooltip
data.value: Player whose relation will be modified.

data.name: Description_VendingMachine
data.value: Allows displaying and selling of items.

data.name: AdminScreen_Safezone_Collision
data.value: Safe zone collision. Reduce radius until no safezones are overlapping.

data.name: SafeZoneBlock_Safezone_Collision
data.value: Safe zone collision. Reduce radius or move it

data.name: Connector_TemporaryBlock
data.value: Connection failed. Connector will unblock in {0} seconds.

data.name: Description_FAQ_ContractBlock
data.value: A Contract block lets you set up your own contracts for other players to complete. You can also accept contracts from Trading stations.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Contracts
data.value: Contracts can be accepted trough contract blocks and are a good income of space credit. They can be found at trading stations or from other players with contract blocks.

data.name: Description_FAQ_SafeZoneBlock
data.value: The safe zone block projects a configurable zone to protect your base. The safe zone block requires power and zone chips to function. Zone chips can be bought from trading stations.

data.name: Description_FAQ_SpaceCredit
data.value: Space Credit is the universal currency used to trade with stations and other players. You can withdraw or deposit space credits from store blocks.

data.name: Description_FAQ_StoreBlock
data.value: You can use a store block to trade with players or other factions. Trading can be done from ship inventories when using connectors with trade functions enabled.

data.name: Description_FAQ_TradeStations
data.value: Trade stations can spawn on planets, moons in orbit or in deep space. Depending on what faction owns the trade station it can sell Ores, components, amunitions, fuel and ships and let you do contracts for them.

data.name: Description_FAQ_Trading
data.value: You can trade with players and stations using Store blocks. Trading with players can be done directly by pressing F3.
